job_description: Research Analyst II (Data to Action Services Project) - job post R.L. KLEIN & ASSOCIATES. Los Angeles, CA 90005 $5,671 a month -  Full-time, Temporary Apply now Apply now save-icon Job details Salary $5,671 a month Job Type Full-time Temporary We are looking for a Research Analyst to ensure that surveillance data is used to optimize prevention, care and treatment programming, the local HIV and STD epidemics are characterized using high quality data, surveillance and epidemiological data are rapidly available and widely used for data-to-care and other decision making, and that data partnerships between technical teams are strengthened and synergized. In this role, you will ensure the local HIV epidemic is characterized using high quality data, HIV surveillance and epidemiological data are rapidly available and widely used for data-to-care and other decision making, and that data partnerships between technical teams are strengthened and synergized. Primary Responsibilities will include: · Perform data matches/record linkages between HIV/STD surveillance databases and other disease registries; and · Prepare data visualization materials and data dashboards using Power BI for sharing surveillance data internally and externally; and · Assist with surveillance-based data-to care activities, including prioritizing case follow-up, performing record searches to identify cases that are truly out of care, performing quality control activities, and coordinating with the Linkage and Reengagement Program; and · Work with the perinatal HIV team to develop tools to ensure complete reporting and follow-up of HIV-exposed infants; and · Collaborate with programmatic and HIV prevention managers to provide data materials that can be optimized for public health response; and · Participate in community meetings, quality assurance activities, Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) conference calls, required trainings, staff meetings, and other project activities, as needed. Minimum Qualifications: · Master’s degree in public health or health administration fields. · Valid California driver’s license, proof of vehicle insurance, and reliable transportation, or ability to secure timely transportation for off-site travel to various community sites throughout Los Angeles County as needed. · Experience with electronic medical records, healthcare data system, data quality assurance, and disease surveillance. · Excellent interpersonal and communication skills. Desirable Qualifications: · Experience with SAS programming or other statistical software. · Knowledge of HIV diseases, laboratory diagnostic technologies, and reporting regulations. · Ability to work independently with minimal supervision Contact us: For immediate consideration, contact us at (888) 755-5629 Job Types: Full-time, Temporary Pay: $5,671.00 per month Benefits: Dental insurance Health insurance Schedule: Monday to Friday Work Location: In person Health insurance If you require alternative methods of application or screening, you must approach the employer directly to request this as Indeed is not responsible for the employer's application process.
